snippet: The primal scream of New York is often let loose by people whose car windows have been smashed. Those screams became one extended aria Tuesday morning when drivers discovered thousands of dollars’ worth of damage to cars in Upper Manhattan.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column; vandals break windows of cars parked along Cabrini Boulevard in Upper Manhattan, causing thousands of dollars' worth of damage in seemingly pointless crime.
lead_paragraph: The primal scream of New York is often let loose by people whose car windows have been smashed. Those screams became one extended aria Tuesday morning when drivers discovered thousands of dollars’ worth of damage to cars in Upper Manhattan.

headline.main: A Vandalism Spree Leaves Behind a Trail of Broken Glass and Frustration
headline.print_headline: A Vandalism Spree Leaves Behind a Trail of Broken Glass and Frustration
